巎字的基本解释

巎
náo
古山名，在中国今山东省淄博市境。
古书上说的一种犬。

巎字的汉语字典释义

[①]［náo］
［《廣韻》奴刀切，平豪，泥。］
(1)同“峱”。山名。
(2)人名用字。元代有书法家巎巎，字子山。参阅元史本传。

巎字的康熙字典解释

【寅集中】【山字部】　巎； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页322第34
【玉篇】奴刀切。同峱。

巎字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
巎字的起名意思

古山名。

Yin
Basic explanation of words
Yin
náo
Ancient mountain name, in the border of Zibo City, Shandong Province, China.
A kind of dog mentioned in ancient books.
Yin
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [náo]
["Guangyun" slave knife cut, Pinghao, mud. ]
(1) Same as "峱". Mountain name.
(2) Use characters for names. In the Yuan Dynasty, there was a calligrapher, Nuo, with the word Zishan. Refer to the Biography of Yuan History.
Yin
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Yin Collection] [Mountain Character Department] 　巎; Kangxi Strokes: 21; Pages: Page 322-34
[Jade articles] Slave cutting. The same 峱.
